question.title: What is the primary factor that leads to the onset of arrhythmia in the context of chronic hypokalaemia?
question.description: Select the correct answer from the options below

option_a.title: Hypomagnesaemia
option_a.description: A condition characterized by low levels of magnesium in the blood

option_b.title: Left ventricular hypertrophy
option_b.description: A condition where the muscle wall of the left ventricle becomes thickened

option_c.title: Underlying ischaemic heart disease
option_c.description: A condition where the heart muscle does not receive enough oxygen due to blocked arteries

option_d.title: Hypercalcaemia
option_d.description: A condition characterized by high levels of calcium in the blood

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option
